About the University of Cape Town, UCT School Fees Structure 2024

The UCT Fees structures for the University of Cape Town are given as follows. All admitted students are expected to review the fees structures for all courses/programs in the University.

The management of the University of Cape Town (UCT) has urged all students to pay their fees on or before the deadline. The portal will be open until the last day of registration for both Undergraduate and Postgraduate students.

Before you pay UCT fees, find the actual fees applicable to your program (Courses) for the 2024 Undergraduate/Graduate admission.

University of Cape Town Fees

The University of Cape Town (UCT) is a public research university in Cape Town, South Africa. The fees for UCT vary depending on the degree program, level of study, and citizenship of the student.

For the 2024 academic year, the estimated annual tuition fees for undergraduate programs range from ZAR 47,500 to ZAR 84,000 for South African citizens and residents, and from ZAR 67,000 to ZAR 141,500 for international students.

For postgraduate programs, the estimated annual tuition fees range from ZAR 26,000 to ZAR 153,000 for South African citizens and residents, and from ZAR 46,500 to ZAR 213,000 for international students.

Please note that these fees are subject to change and do not include additional costs such as accommodation, meals, textbooks, and other living expenses.

How To Pay UCT School Fees Using Bank Method:

Students are to pay the UCT Tuition fees in the following accounts as applicable to the course (Programmes) of studies.

To see the breakdown of UCT School fees, click here

How to Pay UCT Application Fees 2024

  • Login to the UCT Payment portal
  • Sign in with your username and password
  • Click the pay fees link
  • Follow the instructions on the screen.

To learn more about the UCT application fees for 2024 admissions, please click here.

The application fee may be paid by cash, credit card, direct bank deposit, or electronic funds transfer (EFT). Cash payments must be made at the Cashiers Office, Kramer Building, Middle Campus, UCT.

How to Pay University of Cape Town Fees

There are several ways to pay University of Cape Town fees. Here are a few options:

Online Payment:

You can make payments online through the University of Cape Town’s Student iEnabler system. This is the preferred method of payment as it is quick, secure and efficient.

Bank Transfer:

You can make a direct deposit or bank transfer to the University of Cape Town’s bank account. You will need to provide your student number and the purpose of payment when making the transfer.

Payment at the Cashier’s Office:

You can also make payments at the University of Cape Town’s Cashier’s Office. You can pay with cash, credit card, or debit card. Please note that due to the Covid-19 pandemic, the Cashier’s Office may have specific operating hours and protocols that need to be followed.

Payment via Third-Party Payment Providers:

The University of Cape Town also accepts payments through third-party payment providers such as PayFast, which allows you to pay via credit card or EFT.

It is important to note that fees and payment options may differ depending on your program, so be sure to consult with the University of Cape Town’s Finance department or visit their website for more information.

How to Pay University of Cape Town Fees Online

To pay University of Cape Town fees online, you will need to follow these steps:
  1. Log in to the University of Cape Town’s Student iEnabler system using your student number and password.
  2. Click on the “Finance” tab on the menu bar.
  3. Click on the “Make Payment” link.
  4. Select the fees you want to pay.
  5. Choose the payment method “Credit Card” or “Instant EFT” (Electronic Fund Transfer).
  6. If you choose “Credit Card,” enter your credit card details, including the card number, expiry date, and CVV number.
  7. If you choose “Instant EFT,” select your bank from the list provided and follow the instructions to complete the payment.
  8. Confirm the payment details and click “Pay.”
  9. If your payment is successful, a confirmation message will appear on the screen, and you will receive an email notification.

It is important to note that there may be additional charges for using the online payment system, and the payment may take up to 48 hours to reflect in your account. If you have any issues with the online payment system, you can contact the University of Cape Town’s Finance department for assistance.

Click here to Pay UCT School Fees Online

How to Access UCT Student iEnabler System

To access the UCT Student iEnabler system, follow these steps:
  1. Open your web browser and go to the UCT website (www.uct.ac.za).
  2. Click on the “Students” link on the top navigation menu.
  3. From the drop-down menu, click on “Student Portal.”
  4. On the Student Portal page, click on the “iEnabler” link.
  5. You will be directed to the UCT iEnabler login page.
  6. Enter your student number and password to log in.
  7. Once you have successfully logged in, you will be able to access various student services, including registration, fees, academic records, and more.
  • UCT Application Form 2024 | University of Cape Town

FAQ about How to Pay University of Cape Town Fees Online

Here are some frequently asked questions about paying University of Cape Town fees online:
What payment methods are accepted for online payments?

The University of Cape Town accepts credit card payments and instant EFT payments through the Student iEnabler system. However, the available payment methods may vary depending on your location and the program you are enrolled in.

Is it safe to pay University of Cape Town fees online?

Yes, the University of Cape Town’s online payment system is secure and uses industry-standard encryption to protect your personal and financial information.

Are there any additional fees for using the online payment system?

There may be additional charges for using the online payment system, depending on the payment method you choose. For example, if you pay by credit card, there may be a transaction fee charged by the credit card company.

How long does it take for my payment to be reflected in my account?

It may take up to 48 hours for your payment to be reflected in your account, depending on the payment method you choose and your bank’s processing time.

What should I do if I have issues with the online payment system?

If you encounter any issues with the online payment system, you can contact the University of Cape Town’s Finance department for assistance. They can provide guidance on the payment process and help resolve any payment-related issues.
